block.label: Logistics

radio.label: Location
radio.title: Sample Source (web) / Location (web to clt)
radio.row: Oi Research- Online Interactive Research Limited

text.label: LocationCode
text.title: This is used to assign each location's unique identifying code from the Location question row label. Do not edit.

block.note: Edit logic based on country - if one country, use "True", if multiple countries, assign based on sample company. Make sure field department knows to alert you if they are adding a sample company

html.label: Intro
html.p:
Hello and welcome to our survey!
Thank you in advance for your participation.  This study is very important to us and we ask that you answer each question carefully and completely.
While going through the survey, please use the scroll bar on the right and bottom of your screen to move up and down through questions and images.  Please remember that there are no right or wrong answers.  We are only interested in your opinions.
Thank you again!  Let’s begin…

autofill.label: Months
autofill.title: Enter number of months here 1,3,6,12 for past purchased, BUMO

checkbox.label: S_PastParticipation
checkbox.title: Have you participated in a market research study within the past 2 weeks, on any of the following topics?
checkbox.row: Baking and Decorating Ingredients and Supplies

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you, or does anyone in your immediate family work for any of the following industries?
checkbox.row: Advertising agency or public relations firms
A graphic design or packaging firm
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution, or sale of toilet paper products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution, or sale of salty snack products
A company involved in the manufacturing, distribution or sale of baking/decorating products

term.label: TERM_Industry
term.cond: (S_Industry.r1 or S_Industry.r2 or S_Industry.r3 or S_Industry.r6)

select.label: S_GroceryShop
select.title: How much of the household’s [pipe: Category] grocery shopping do you, yourself, do?

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you identify?

number.label: S_Age
number.title: Please type in your age below.

radio.label: S_Frequency
radio.title: How often have you purchased products in each of the following categories?

radio.label: v_FreqClutter1
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter1] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r1.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r1.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r1.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r1.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r1.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r1.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r1.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqClutter2
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Clutter2] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.r3.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.r3.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.r3.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.r3.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.r3.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.r3.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.r3.c7: data.val=6

radio.label: v_FreqTest
radio.title: Virtual for Weighting - [pipe: Category] Frequency - DO NOT MODIFY
radio.virtual: if S_Frequency.TB.c1: data.val=0 if S_Frequency.TB.c2: data.val=1 if S_Frequency.TB.c3: data.val=2 if S_Frequency.TB.c4: data.val=3 if S_Frequency.TB.c5: data.val=4 if S_Frequency.TB.c6: data.val=5 if S_Frequency.TB.c7: data.val=6

checkbox.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased2
checkbox.title: Which brand or brands of [pipe: Category] have you purchased in the past 6 months?

radio.label: S_Brand_BUMO2
radio.title: And which one brand of [pipe: Category] have you purchased most often in the 6 months?

autofill.label: S_Brand_PastPurchased
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

autofill.label: S_Brand_BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO - User/Non User for Database
autofill.row: TestBrand User - all test brands netted

radio.label: Segment_1
radio.title: How strongly do you agree or disagree with these statements about your general attitudes and opinions about life?

comment.i: Select one response for each statement.

radio.row: It is important for me to keep up with the latest trends in home decorating, fashion and lifestyle
I appreciate when brands show diversity in their advertising
It is important to me that I find ways to express myself creatively

radio.label: Segment_2
radio.title: How strongly do you agree or disagree with these statements about your thoughts and feelings towards food and nutrition?

comment.i: Select one response for each statement.

radio.row: Most of what I eat today was shaped by the recipes / meals I ate in my childhood
I regularly connect with my friends and family over food / meals
When I decide what food I choose to eat, nutrition plays a big role
If there is a healthier option available, I usually try to take it

radio.label: Segment_3
radio.title: How strongly do you agree or disagree with these statements about baking or decorating sweet treats?

comment.i: Select one response for each statement.

radio.row: I mostly learned how to bake/decorate from friends/family
Making treats for family and friends shows them you care
I consider baking/decorating a moment of self-care
I typically try to incorporate healthier ingredients when baking / decorating
I tend to do things by the book rather than improvise when baking / decorating

number.label: hTTValue
number.title: Values
number.exec: hTTValue.r1.val= 5-Segment_1.r1.val hTTValue.r2.val= 5-Segment_1.r2.val hTTValue.r3.val= 5-Segment_1.r3.val hTTValue.r4.val= 5-Segment_2.r1.val hTTValue.r5.val= 5-Segment_2.r2.val hTTValue.r6.val= 5-Segment_2.r3.val hTTValue.r7.val= 5-Segment_2.r4.val hTTValue.r8.val= 5-Segment_3.r1.val hTTValue.r9.val= 5-Segment_3.r2.val hTTValue.r10.val= 5-Segment_3.r3.val hTTValue.r11.val= 5-Segment_3.r4.val hTTValue.r12.val= 5-Segment_3.r5.val hTTValue.r13.val = 1
number.row: a01 It is important for me to keep up with the latest trends in home decorating, fashion and lifestyle
a02 I appreciate when brands show diversity in their advertising
a03 It is important to me that I find ways to express myself creatively
a04 Most of what I eat today was shaped by the recipes / meals I ate in my childhood
a05 I regularly connect with my friends and family over food / meals
a06 When I decide what food I choose to eat, nutrition plays a big role
a07 If there is a healthier option available, I usually try to take it
a08 I mostly learned how to bake/decorate from friends/family
a09 Making treats for family and friends shows them you care
a10 I consider baking/decorating a moment of self-care
a11 I typically try to incorporate healthier ingredients when baking / decorating
a12 I tend to do things by the book rather than improvise when baking / decorating

radio.label: hfinalSeg
radio.title: final Segment
radio.exec: arr = [row.val for row in SegmentCal.rows] hfinalSeg.val = arr.index(max(arr))

block.label: Quotas

row.label: r3
row.autofill: (S_Gender.r3 or S_Gender.r4 or S_Gender.r5 or S_Gender.r6)

autofill.label: Usage
autofill.title: Usage Past Purchased (P3M, P6M, P12M) FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

autofill.label: BUMO
autofill.title: BUMO FULL LIST break out - netted where needed

autofill.label: User
autofill.title: This is "user" as defined by the insights team - the user by which they are running their data in crosstabs (and thus the norms)- this is defined as either past purchased or BUMO – as instructed by insights. Logic will be the same as S_Brand_PastPurchased OR S_Brand_BUMO.

autofill.label: SubGroups
autofill.title: This is used to capture the subgroups to be combined from Cat Rep and Supplements to be run in ART

block.exec: if PhaseQ.r1: Phase.val=0 if PhaseQ.r2: Phase.val=1 if PhaseQ.r3: Phase.val=2

radio.label: Phase
radio.title: Phase

number.label: resp_id
number.title: Respondent ID

radio.label: S_Omni_Research
radio.title: Thinking about the Baking/Decorating category, how much browsing or research do you typically do "online" and "in store"  before shopping?

radio.label: S_Omni_ShoppingPlan
radio.title: Thinking about the baking/decorating category and the different occassions when you shop it, would you say your shopping is more planned or impromptu?

block.label: AgreementBlock
block.note: THIS QUESTION SHOULD BE LEFT IN TO ENSURE QUALITY OF INTERVIEWING AND THAT IT'S NOT A BOT TAKING THE SURVEY

radio.label: RedHerringCheck
radio.title: Which of the following is not a color?

radio.label: Agreement
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will use information or material disclosed to you or which may be available as part of this study only for the purpose of participating in this study, and you will not otherwise use the information or material for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You agree to keep confidential and not disclose, copy, transmit, or use for any purpose other than your participation in this study any information or material disclosed or made available to you as part of the study, including about products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this study. Any disclosure, copying, transmitting or misuse of any information or material in any form (including hard copy and/or electronic/data) whether intentional or unintentional may subject you to disqualification, and any other remedies available to Behaviorally or its study partners in law or equity.
You agree that Behaviorally (and its partners) will be irreparably harmed and monetary damages may not be adequate compensation if you fail to meet your obligations under this agreement, and that, in addition to other remedies, Behaviorally (or its partners) shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief to prevent any threatened or continued breach. The parties hereby waive any requirements for security for obtaining any provisional relief.
Each of Behaviorally’s partners is an intended third-party beneficiary of this agreement and each partner may enforce the terms of this agreement.
As further detailed in our privacy policy (https://www.behaviorally.com/privacy-policy), we take reasonable precautions to protect the privacy and security of your information during the market research survey. All information collected as part of this survey is treated in accordance with our online privacy policy and is destroyed 2 months after you have taken this survey. You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

text.label: DateTime
text.title: DateTime
text.exec:
from datetime import datetime
cur_time = datetime.now() DateTime.val = cur_time.strftime("%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S")

survey.note: PROG: Only include QC Core Block1 if there is QC Core

block.label: ShoppingSection
block.builder:title: Shopping Section

pipe.label: continue_text
pipe.case: Please click the Continue button to proceed

block.label: RealEyeExercise
block.builder:title: Real Eye Exercise
block.html:
Hi! Your privacy and comfort are important to us!
You will be asked to turn on your webcam on the next page.
Your face and your background will not be recorded.
Just so you know - only the green dot area is being looked at for movement as you engage with our content.
[pipe:GREENDOTS]
block.note: Programmer NOTE: THIS RE_AreementBlock is for studies in Europe Only and is set FALSE for all other countries

block.label: RE_AgreementBlock
block.cond: Country.FR or Country.UK or Country.DE or Country.IT or Country.ES or Country.PL or Country.NL or Country.CH or Country.AT or Country.DK

radio.label: RE_Agreement
radio.title:
At one point in the study, you will see images and we would like to use your computer’s webcam to provide data that will allow us to analyze the movement of your eyes and their movement relative to the images you are being shown.
Please know - We never store any images or videos from your webcam. By analyzing eye behavior, our client Behaviorally can understand more about how people react to various images.
These data points will be analyzed by computer, and final data output will be mixed with those of other people who take part in this study.
With your permission, researchers from Behaviorally may view the gaze prediction data to check everything is working correctly. The technology used is provided by our trusted partner RealEye. All data is processed and kept securely in accordance with the RealEye Privacy Policy (https://www.realeye.io/about/privacy/).
By consenting, you agree to share the data points reference above. This data will only be used for market research and analysis purposes associated with this Project and will not be shared in any public domain.

row.label: r1
row.b: Yes, I agree and consent to participate

row.label: r2
row.b: No, I do not agree, and I understand that the survey will end at this time

block.html: Redirect placeholder so that the redirect executes

autofill.label: EF_Status
autofill.title: Real Eye: Status
autofill.row: Skip (I don't want to participate in this test)

textarea.label: RE_Open
textarea.title: Please help us to understand why you decided to not take part in the webcam eye-tracking test.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.term: Real Eye: Skip/ Screen Out/ RealEye OQ

block.html:
Shelf Exercise Explanation:
In this exercise shoppers are asked to shop the test category as if they would actually be in their usual store, doing their purchases. For this, the category shelf is shown to shoppers again and respondents can zoom in on the shelf to see the products in greater detail. Shoppers can also click on individual products to enlarge them and either purchase them or put them back on shelf.

number.label: P_QuantityPurchased
number.title: Assume for a moment that you are doing your shopping for baking/decorating products. Please select the products that you wish to purchase by clicking on the individual products on the shelf. You may purchase as many or as few products as you like.

ul.li: If you would like to see a close-up of a product, hover your mouse over the product.
If you would like to purchase a product, click on the product and use the "+/-" buttons to add quantity and click "Purchase"
To change your mind about purchasing a product, click on the "back" button or click on the shopping cart to remove products.
When finished with the shopping trip, click the "continue" button on the bottom of your screen.
Please be sure to view the entire shelf before proceeding. You may need to scroll over/down to do so.

number.row: Wilton BLUE ICING POUCH W TIP
Wilton GREEN ICING POUCH W TIPS
Wilton RED ICING POUCH W TIP
Wilton WHITE ICING POUCH W TIPS
Betty Crocker - Birthday Candles - Cupcake Numerals
Wilton BLACK ICING POUCH W TIP
Wilton PINK ICING POUCH W TIPS
Wilton YELLOW ICING POUCH W TIPS
Wilton VIOLET ICING POUCH W TIPS
Betty Crocker Classic Gel Food Coloring
Betty Crocker - Writing Icing - Classic Colors Multi Pack
Betty Crocker - Baking Cups - Box - All Holidays
Betty Crocker - Baking Cups - Box - Cool in Blue
Betty Crocker - Baking Cups - Box - Pretty in Pink
Betty Crocker - Baking Cups - Cup - All White
Betty Crocker - Multi-Cell Sprinkles - Cool in Blue
Betty Crocker - Multi-Cell Sprinkles - All Holiday
Betty Crocker - Multi-Cell Sprinkles - All Holiday Sugars
Betty Crocker Mixes Triple Choc Fudge
Duncan Hines Mixes Dark Chocolate Fudge

block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: AUTOFILL LOGIC FOR TB MUST BE UPDATED "P1_Items_Bought.r1 or P1_Items_Bought.r2" etc... for all the test products on shelf. Verify with insights team which are test products before writing the logic.
PROGRAMMER NOTE: AUTOFILL LOGIC FOR THE MAIN 2 COMPETITORS IN THE SHOPPING LIST - THIS IS FOR REPORTING PURPOSES AND MUST BE POPULATED
Shopping Question Bank: ShoppingMotivation_OE, ShoppingBarriers_OE, ShoppingBarriers_List are all OPTIONAL

number.label: P1_Total_Products
number.title: Total Products Purchased
number.virtual: data.val = sum([int(r.c1.val) for r in P_QuantityPurchased.rows if r.c1.val and int(r.c1.val) gt 0])

number.label: P1_Number_Bought_Per_Product
number.title: Total Quantity Purchased Per Product

checkbox.label: P1_Items_Bought
checkbox.title: Products Bought

checkbox.label: Wilton_Franchise
checkbox.title: Wilton Franchise
checkbox.virtual:
if (P1_Items_Bought.C3 or P1_Items_Bought.C4 or P1_Items_Bought.C5 or P1_Items_Bought.C6 or P1_Items_Bought.C7 or P1_Items_Bought.D3 or P1_Items_Bought.D4 or P1_Items_Bought.D5 or P1_Items_Bought.D6 or P1_Items_Bought.H4 or P1_Items_Bought.H5 or P1_Items_Bought.H7 or P1_Items_Bought.H8 or P1_Items_Bought.H9 or P1_Items_Bought.H10 or P1_Items_Bought.I6 or P1_Items_Bought.I7 or P1_Items_Bought.I8 or P1_Items_Bought.J1 or P1_Items_Bought.J2 or P1_Items_Bought.J3 or P1_Items_Bought.J4 or P1_Items_Bought.L1 or P1_Items_Bought.L2 or P1_Items_Bought.L3) : Wilton_Franchise.r1.val = 1
else: Wilton_Franchise.r2.val = 1

number.label: P1_Items_Bought2
number.title: Products bought at P_QuantityPurchased.
number.virtual: if(P_QuantityPurchased.A1.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r1.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A2.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r2.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A3.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r3.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A4.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r4.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A5.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r5.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A6.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r6.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A10.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r10.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.A11.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r11.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.B1.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r12.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.C6.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r22.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.C7.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r23.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.D1.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r24.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.D2.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r25.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.D3.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r26.val=1 if(P_QuantityPurchased.D4.c1): P1_Items_Bought2.r27.val=1 block.label: IAT
block.builder:title: Immediate Association Test
block.html:
The Immediate Association Test Explained:
In the immediate association test we want to find out whether the designs quickly and intuitively convey key attributes within a competitive context. For this, respondents are shown the test product and two key competitors. For each statement or attribute, respondents are given 6 seconds (maximum) to choose which product / brand best applies to the statement.
block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: 0 is neutral, 00 is fair DO NOT need to be captured in the summary table - - 1 is unique and different from other brands is the FIRST data point captured here

checkbox.label: vIM1B
checkbox.title: Test IAT Summary Table
checkbox.virtual:
if IM1B_1.c1: vIM1B.r1.c1.val=1 if IM1B_1.c2: vIM1B.r1.c2.val=1 if IM1B_1.c3: vIM1B.r1.c3.val=1

if IM1B_6.c1: vIM1B.r6.c1.val=1 if IM1B_6.c2: vIM1B.r6.c2.val=1 if IM1B_6.c3: vIM1B.r6.c3.val=1
if IM1B_7.c1: vIM1B.r7.c1.val=1 if IM1B_7.c2: vIM1B.r7.c2.val=1 if IM1B_7.c3: vIM1B.r7.c3.val=1
if IM1B_8.c1: vIM1B.r8.c1.val=1 if IM1B_8.c2: vIM1B.r8.c2.val=1 if IM1B_8.c3: vIM1B.r8.c3.val=1
if IM1B_9.c1: vIM1B.r9.c1.val=1 if IM1B_9.c2: vIM1B.r9.c2.val=1 if IM1B_9.c3: vIM1B.r9.c3.val=1

checkbox.row: Is unique and different from other brands
Helps me create something to share with others
Did not choose product for any statement

html.label: IM1
html.span:
You are now going to see another series of statements and products on your screen.
Please pay attention as it's going to be very quick.
As soon as a statement appears you will have 5 seconds to click on the product that best fits with the statement.
Ready? Please continue.

block.label: b1a
block.builder:title: default loop block

radio.label: IM1B_[loopvar: label]

float.label: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label]
float.title: Pack Attribute Times
float.exec: for row in packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows: packAttTimesnlivea_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val = float(packAttTimesa_[loopvar: label].rows[row.index].val or 0)

block.note: Is Unique and different from other brands is a Plus standard statement and should always be in position 1

textarea.label: IM2_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: What specifically about the [pipe: Brand] made you say it was "[loopvar:statement]" than the others?

block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: 0 is neutral, 00 is fair, and 1 is unique and different from other brands need to remain in IAT for all studies and not edited.

looprow.loopvar: Is unique and different from other brands
Helps me create something to share with others

block.label: FlashExposure
block.html: You are now going to be shown a picture on the screen. Please pay attention as it’s going to be a very short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Practice
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1/2 second, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Practice_OE
textarea.title: Please describe everything you saw, even if you are not sure about it.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.html: You are now going to be shown another picture on the screen. Please pay attention as it’s going to be a very short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Flash1
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1/2 seconds, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Flash1_OE
textarea.title: Please describe everything you saw, even if you are not sure about it.
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.note: REMOVING FLASH 2 from all PF. Aug 1, 2022 as per new architecture
Flash 2 may have been left in here for historical architecture but is now turned false - will delete soon April 12 2023
block.html: You will now see the same picture again. Pay attention as it’s going to be a short exposure.

checkbox.label: F_Flash2
checkbox.title: Please review the image below. After 1 second, you will automatically be advanced to the next page.

textarea.label: F_Flash2_OE
textarea.title: What else have you seen?
textarea.comment: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible.

block.note: PROGRAMMER NOTE: IF Fit, Und and Usual are included - they must be choice 1, 2, 3 and NOT randomized. Labels must stay as is for Norms
PROGRAMMER NOTE: Usual - ask if Past buyers Past purchased selectes Test Brand -- logic is built in: cond="S_Brand_PastPurchased.TB"

radio.label: F_Flash3
radio.title: How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to this product based on what you have just seen.

ul.ul:
10 means that you strongly agree with the statement
1 means that you strongly disagree with the statement

div.strong: You may choose any number from 1 to 10 that best describes your opinion.

strong.span: Based on what you have just seen, would you say that….

radio.row: The packaging fits very well with what I expect from baking/decorating products
It is easy to understand what product it is
You recognize this as your usual product/brand
It is a high quality product
It is for someone like me

radio.label: Straightliner_Flash3
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch - Just Tracking for Flash3

block.label: Findability_Section
block.builder:title: Findability Section
block.html:
Next, you are going to see the display of baking/decorating products again.
This time, you will be looking for one particular item.
When you see the display,Please find [pipe: Finda].
When you find this product, please use your mouse and click on the center of the product to select it.
When you are ready, click continue to begin.

number.label: F1
number.title:
Again, you are looking for:
[pipe: Finda upper]

radio.label: F1_Item_Found
radio.title: Product Found

block.note: Findability Question Bank: Differentiation, FamilyFit are OPTIONAL

block.label: DoNotModifyDataBase
block.builder:title: Do Not Modify - for DataBaseCollection

autofill.label: CorrectlyFound
autofill.title: Correctly Found - Was the Respondent a TestBrand User (based off of Usage)

block.note: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located

radio.label: EaseOfFind
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

radio.label: vEaseOfFind
radio.title: DO NOT MODIFY: EaseOfFind - Filtered by Correctly Located How easy or difficult do you think it was to find this product?
radio.row: Neither easy nor difficult to find

radio.label: Differentiation
radio.title: How easy or difficult do you think it is to tell the difference between these [pipe: Brand] products?
radio.row: Very easy to tell the difference
Somewhat easy to tell the difference
Neither easy nor difficult to tell the difference
Somewhat difficult to tell the difference
Very difficult to tell the difference

radio.label: FamilyFit
radio.title: How well do the [pipe: Brand] products fit together as a family?

textarea.label: F_Highlight_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: When finding [pipe: Finda], which one part of the packaging was most useful in helping you find what you were looking for?
textarea.comment: Using your mouse, highlight the single part of the packaging that was most useful.

block.label: Attitudinal
block.html:
You are now going to see the picture of a pack. On that picture, you will be asked to highlight the areas you like most about the pack, if there are any.
Then on that same picture, you will be asked to highlight the areas you dislike about the pack, if any.

Areas of Appeal Exercise:
PROGRAMMER: Show stimuli according to the phase as indicated below:
block.note: Likes/Dislikes TWO - FOR 360 only
LIKES/DISLIKES THREE - FOR 360 only
Attitudinal Question Bank Question: Q_InitialImpressions is OPTIONAL
Attitudinal Quesiton Bank - THIS IS ALTERNATE IMPLICIT AND IS OPTIONAL- REMOVE IF REGULAR PACKATTS IS USED
Communication "PayMore" is only for Core and Plus. It is not standard for 360 but I gave it a standard label for reporting
Either PI or Propensity will be used here based on the QNR
Attitudinal Question Bank Part 3: Q_Benefit, Benefit_OE, PricePerception Block are optional

textarea.label: Q_Likes_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: Using your mouse, please highlight the aspects of the packaging you like most (if any). If there's nothing that you specifically like, please click "I don’t like any of it" at the bottom of the page.
textarea.validate: if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label]
checkbox.validate: if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Likes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_LikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)
checkbox.row: I don’t like any of it

textarea.label: Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label]
textarea.title: Using your mouse, please highlight the aspects of the packaging you dislike (if any). If there's nothing that you specifically dislike, please click "I don’t dislike any of it" at the bottom of the page.
textarea.validate: if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)

checkbox.label: Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label]
checkbox.validate: if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val != "" and Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1: error(res.MapError) if Q_Dislikes_[loopvar: label].c1.val == "" and not(Q_DislikesNone_[loopvar: label].r1): error(res.MapError2)
checkbox.row: I don’t dislike any of it

block.html:
For the next few questions, please focus your attention on the [pipe: Brand] packaging you see here.
[pipe: PH_IMG]

checkbox.label: Q_PackAtt
checkbox.title: You will now see some words and phrases that could be used to describe the appearance of various products. Do you think the Wilton packaging is…

radio.label: Q_Communication
radio.title: [pipe: PH_IMG]
radio.comment:
How much do you agree or disagree that the following phrases apply to the [pipe: Brand] products?
These [pipe: Brand] products…
radio.row: Are made by a brand I can trust
Safe for me and my family (Bakeware)

radio.label: Straightliner
radio.title: DO NOT REMOVE OR MODIFY - Straightliner Punch

radio.label: Q_PI
radio.title: How likely would you be to buy these Wilton products, if they were available for the prices you see below?

textarea.label: Q_Custom1
textarea.title: Looking at the options of bakeware below, what differences do you notice, if any? Please list anything that comes to mind.

textarea.label: Q_Custom2
textarea.title: Looking at the options of bakeware below, which would you rather purchase and why?

strong.em: Now, just a few questions for classification purposes…

checkbox.label: C_Store
checkbox.title: Where do you typically buy [pipe: Category lower]?
checkbox.row: At a physical store only (like a pharmacy, grocery store or mass merchandiser)
Mostly online and occasionally at a physical store
Mostly at a physical store and occasionally online
Both online and at a physical store equally

checkbox.label: C_Devices
checkbox.cond: (C_Store.r2 or C_Store.r3 or C_Store.r4 or C_Store.r5)
checkbox.title: You mentioned you bought [pipe: Category lower] online, what devices do you use to shop for them online?

checkbox.label: C_OnlineStores
checkbox.cond: (C_Store.r2 or C_Store.r3 or C_Store.r4 or C_Store.r5)
checkbox.title: You mentioned you bought [pipe: Category lower] online, where specifically?

checkbox.label: C_Delivery
checkbox.cond: (C_Store.r2 or C_Store.r3 or C_Store.r4 or C_Store.r5)
checkbox.title: You mentioned you bought baking/decorating products online, how do you usually get the them after you buy it?
checkbox.row: Buy online and pick up at the store
Buy online and get it delivered to my home
Buy online and get it delivered to my work
Buy online and get it delivered to a locker or place where I can pick it up

select.label: S_State
select.title: Please select the US state in which you currently live.

select.label: C_Employment
select.title: Which of the following best describes your current employment status?

select.label: STANDARD_EDUCATION
select.title: What is the highest level of education you have completed?
select.choice: Other post high school vocational training
Completed some college, but no degree
Completed some graduate, but no degree

select.label: STANDARD_INCOME
select.title: Please select the range that best represents your total annual household income.

select.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY
select.title: Which of the following best describes you?
select.choice: Black or African American, or Black British

checkbox.label: STANDARD_ETHNICITY2
checkbox.title: Please select all of the following that describe you.
checkbox.row: Black or African American, or Black British
